Package com.github.jh3nd3rs0n.jargyle.internal.net.ssl

Class DtlsDatagramSocket

java.lang.Object
java.net.DatagramSocket
com.github.jh3nd3rs0n.jargyle.internal.net.FilterDatagramSocket
com.github.jh3nd3rs0n.jargyle.internal.net.ssl.DtlsDatagramSocket
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
public final class DtlsDatagramSocket extends FilterDatagramSocket
A DatagramSocket layered with Datagram Transport Layer Security (DTLS).

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static final class 
    DtlsDatagramSocket.ConnectionClosedException
    Thrown when a DTLS connection is closed.
    static final class 
    DtlsDatagramSocket.ConnectionsCloseException
    Thrown when IOExceptions occur upon closing DTLS connections.

      public static final int DEFAULT_WRAPPED_RECEIVE_BUFFER_SIZE
      The default buffer size for receiving DTLS wrapped datagrams.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes this DtlsDatagramSocket. An UncheckedIOException is thrown if any of the DTLS connections is unable to close properly.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Closeable
      Overrides:
      close in class FilterDatagramSocket

    • getEnabledCipherSuites

      public String[] getEnabledCipherSuites()
      Returns a String array of acceptable cipher suites enabled for DTLS connections.

      See SSLEngine.getEnabledCipherSuites() for further details.

      Returns:
      a String array of acceptable cipher suites enabled for DTLS connections

    • setEnabledCipherSuites

      public void setEnabledCipherSuites(String[] suites)
      Sets the String array of acceptable cipher suites enabled for DTLS connections with a provided String array.

      See SSLEngine.setEnabledCipherSuites(String[]) for further details.

      Parameters:
      suites - the provided String array of acceptable cipher suites enabled for DTLS connections

    • getEnabledProtocols

      public String[] getEnabledProtocols()
      Returns a String array of acceptable protocol versions enabled for DTLS connections.

      See SSLEngine.getEnabledProtocols() for further details.

      Returns:
      a String array of acceptable protocol versions enabled for DTLS connections

    • setEnabledProtocols

      public void setEnabledProtocols(String[] protocols)
      Sets the String array of acceptable protocol versions enabled for DTLS connections with the provided String array.

      See SSLEngine.setEnabledProtocols(String[]) for further details.

      Parameters:
      protocols - the provided String array of acceptable protocol versions enabled for DTLS connections

    • getUseClientMode

      public boolean getUseClientMode()
      Returns the boolean value to indicate that this DtlsDatagramSocket will operate in client mode, meaning it will initiate the communication with the peer.

      See SSLEngine.getUseClientMode() for further details.

      Returns:
      the boolean value to indicate that this DtlsDatagramSocket will operate in client mode

    • setUseClientMode

      public void setUseClientMode(boolean mode)
      Sets the boolean value to indicate that this DtlsDatagramSocket will operate in client mode.

      See SSLEngine.setUseClientMode(boolean) for further details.

      Parameters:
      mode - the provided boolean value to indicate that this DtlsDatagramSocket will operate in client mode

    • getWrappedReceiveBufferSize

      public int getWrappedReceiveBufferSize()
      Returns the buffer size for receiving DTLS wrapped datagrams. The default is DEFAULT_WRAPPED_RECEIVE_BUFFER_SIZE.
      Returns:
      the buffer size for receiving DTLS wrapped datagrams

    • setWrappedReceiveBufferSize

      public void setWrappedReceiveBufferSize(int wrapReceiveBufferSize)
      Sets the buffer size for receiving DTLS wrapped datagrams. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the provided buffer size for receiving wrapped datagrams is less than one.
      Parameters:
      wrapReceiveBufferSize - the provided buffer size for receiving DTLS wrapped datagrams
